RelatedSentence: Libya edged closer to civil war last night as Islamist militias prepared to go into battle against a secular rogue general and his supporters who attacked the country 's parliament and vowed to remove them from power .

A1: his supporters who attacked the country 's parliament and vowed to remove them from power
RelatedSentence: Nouri Abusahmain , the Islamist - leaning chief of parliament and Libya 's acting commander-in-chief , ordered his supporters to mobilise in Tripoli after the revolt by forces loyal to General Khalifa Hifter .
His call to arms sets the scene for a violent showdown in the capital between rival militias , who were once fragmented but are rapidly coalescing into Islamist and secular camps .
